[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I just gave my boss the written report. I hope she finds it helpful.
Did you make sure to include all the necessary details?
Yes, I made sure to cover everything we talked about in the meeting. I even added some extra information that I thought could be useful.

It took a lot of hard work, but I'm thrilled with the results. ### Co-workers B: Your father must be really proud of you too. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, he was hesitant to hand over the reins at first, but he trusts me now. Speaking of trust, remember that pen I gave you a few years ago? ### Co-workers B: Of course! I still use it every day at work. ### Co-workers A: I'm glad it's held up well. It was a symbol of our trust in each other, and I'm grateful for our professional relationship. ### Co-workers B: Me too. I think trust is key in both personal and professional relationships. It's what allows us to accomplish great things together.' }
